intro: Hieracium laevigatum subsp. pseudogothicum, commonly known as the lesser hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features basal rosettes of lanceolate, hairy leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in a single, terminal head, surrounded by pale green to brown involucral bracts. It thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats, often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Its botanical characteristics make it a common weed in agricultural and urban environments.
